body_html:
@jart It goes all the way near to the end and then fails. First complaining about -zmuldefs, a flag that is not supported by clang, which is symlinked to gcc on MacOS. If I hand edit the build file and comment it out then it fails at the last step complaining about -lgomp. Commenting that out completes the compile, likely without openMP support.

I'm installing gcc-5.4 now to see whether that improves things.

If I hand edit the build file and comment it out then it fails at the last step complaining about -lgomp. Commenting that out completes the compile, likely without openMP support.
I'm installing gcc-5.4 now to see whether that improves things.
body:
@jart It goes all the way near to the end and then fails. First complaining about `-zmuldefs`, a flag that is not supported by clang, which is symlinked to gcc on MacOS. If I hand edit the build file and comment it out then it fails at the last step complaining about `-lgomp`. Commenting that out completes the compile, likely without openMP support. 

I'm installing gcc-5.4 now to see whether that improves things.
